intro: Tagetes elongata, commonly known as the Mexican tarragon or narrowleaf marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, slightly aromatic scent. Additionally, it is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
